info.name: Reporting
info.description: Adform is offering a wide variety of statistics that can be retrieved on a whim in various different forms depending on your needs. In this section you can find information on how to generate and manage reports, create schedules, generate data exports and retrieve master data. Each of these services can be used to extract meaningful insights from the data to better understand and improve your business performance.

item.name: Data Exports
item.description: This service is dedicated to data export management. It allows retrieving data exports list, creating and editing data export. As it currently stands, this service also provides a way to check data export status and retrieve a link through which the data can be downloaded.

request.description:
This method filters all data exports.

You can filter DataExports using these filter parameters on your request URL:
* DataExportsIds
* Page
* PageSize

EXAMPLE: /Services/DataExport/DataExportsList?Page=1&PageSize=3

This method creates a new DataExport.

Required fields in your request URL:

* DataExport: 
 - Name, 
 - ExportType, 
 - Frequency, 
 - Emails, 
 - StartDate, 
 - EndDate, 
 - ExportColumns, 
 - DataFilters
 
* DataExportFilters: 
 - ReportInterval
 - AdvertiserId

This method updates an existing DataExport.

Required fields in your request URL:

* DataExport: 
 - Id,
 - Name, 
 - ExportType, 
 - Frequency, 
 - Emails, 
 - StartDate, 
 - EndDate, 
 - ExportColumns, 
 - DataFilters
 
* DataExportFilters: 
 - ReportInterval,
 - AdvertiserId

This method deletes Data Export.

You need to parse DataExportId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /Services/DataExport/DataExports?DataExportsIds=111111

This method returns the list of available data export columns depending on specified type.

ExportType has to be defined on your request URL.

Export Types:
- WebVariables,
- BannerVariables,
- Clicks,
- TrackingPoints
- 
EXAMPLE: /DataExport/DataExportColumns?exportType=WebVariables

This method returns status, timing and output destination of a specified Data Export

DataExporName parameter is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /DataExport/DataExportResult?DataExportName=Variable%20Export

item.name: Master Data
item.description:
IMPORTANT: Master data service has to be enabled on the specified account.

IMPORTANT: Depending on the needs, different master data services have to be enabled for different statistics.

Master data service allows you to analyze individual transactions on your agency account to a granular level. The returned data can then be analyzed and manipulated to extract meaningful insights about your business performance and draw conclusions.

request.description:
This method returs a list of available master data files.

You need to parse MasterDataId and Authorization ticket returned by calling SecurityServiceAPI.

EXAMPLE: 8652/list/00000?render=json&authTicket=11111
(00000  MasterDataId, 111111 - Authorization ticket)

item.name: Metadata
item.description: Metadata service returns all available dimensions and metrics that can be used in Reporting Stats API. This service doesn't require an authorization token and can be used as a reference point to understand the possibilities and limitation of our reporting tools.

request.description: This method returns all available dimensions and their names, descriptions and categories.
This method returns all available metrics to be used in Reporting Stats.

item.name: Report Schedules
item.description:
Custom reports allow users to obtain statistics collected in Adform, organized in a way that's most convenient for them. Once such a report is set up in the UI, users have the possibility to have it delivered automatically either once, or periodically. 

Report Schedules API can be used to retrieve, create, edit, and delete such custom report schedules. Comparing to schedule creation and management via UI, certain differences should be had in mind:

In addition to the delivery via e-mail, API also supports sending reports to an FTP server.
Only reports created with the old Report Builder can be created and managed via API.

request.description: This method returns a specified report schedule.

This method creates a new report schedule.

You need to define ReportTemplateId in your request body, also AdvertiserId and CampaignId.

You can retreive ReportTemplateId on Stats&Reports page, under Reports Manager tab in Reports section from UI. 

You can retrieve AdvertiserId using "GET Advertisers" method.

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

This method updates report schedules.

You need to define ReportTemplateId and ReportScheduleId in your request body, also AdvertiserId and CampaignId.

You can retreive ReportTemplateId on Stats&Reports page, under Reports Manager tab in Reports section from UI. 

You can retrieve AdvertiserId using "GET Advertisers" method.

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

This method deletes report schedules.

ReportScheduleId is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLES: Services/ReportSchedule/ReportSchedules?id=111111

item.name: Stats
item.description:
IMPORTANT: Each user has to have "Reporting Stats API" enabled in User Management section.

Reporting Stats API returns report data consisting of statistics derived from the data collected by the Adform tracking code. Each report is organized as dimensions and metrics. Metrics are the individual measurements of user activity on your property, such as impressions, clicks and conversions. Dimensions break down metrics across some common criteria, such as campaign or line item. When you build a query, you specify which dimensions and metrics you want in your report data.

request.description: This method returns stats according to specified filters, dimensions and metrics.
Returns all available dimensions to be used in Reporting Stats Service.
Returns all available metrics to be used in Reporting Stats Service.
